Message.Title: This week's crazed shooter....
Message.Msg: Gunman goes on shooting spree in Tacoma neighborhood Gunman goes on shooting spree in Tacoma neighborhood By Eric W. Dolan Tuesday, March 26, 2013 20:39 EDT A gunman walked through a neighborhood in Tacoma, Washington and fired at houses indiscriminately, according to multiple media reports. No injuries have been reported. Police contained the gunman within his home. He has refused to surrender and is believed to have multiple firearms. Sheriff’s spokesman Ed Troyer said the man has mental health issues. He may have been drinking before the incident. Media helicopters have been ordered to stay 3 miles away. “His firepower is strong enough to reach the helicopters,” Troyer said.

Message.Title: the trickle trickled up
Message.Msg: In 1983 the poorest 47% of America had $15,000 per family, 2.5 percent of the nation's wealth. In 2009 the poorest 47% of America owned ZERO PERCENT of the nation's wealth (their debt exceeded their assets). At the other extreme, the 400 wealthiest Americans own as much wealth as 80 million families -- 62% of America. The reason, once again, is the stock market. Since 1980 the American GDP has approximately doubled. Inflation-adjusted wages have gone down. But the stock market has increased by over ten times, and the richest quintile of Americans owns 93% of it.

America Split in Two: Five Ugly Extremes of Inequality by Paul Buchheit The first step is to learn the facts, and then to get angry and to ask ourselves, as progressives and caring human beings, what we can do about the relentless transfer of wealth to a small group of well-positioned Americans. 1. $2.13 per hour vs. $3,000,000.00 per hour Each of the Koch brothers saw his investments grow by $6 billion in one year, which is three million dollars per hour based on a 40-hour 'work' week. They used some of the money to try to kill renewable energy standards around the country. Their income portrays them, in a society measured by economic status, as a million times more valuable than the restaurant server who cheers up our lunch hours while hoping to make enough in tips to pay the bills. A comparison of top and bottom salaries within large corporations is much less severe, but a lot more common. For CEOs and minimum-wage workers, the difference is $5,000.00 per hour vs. $7.25 per hour.
Points taken, 1. get a job 2. divert ss money to individual stock market accts

did you miss it that not only are most of the 47% working, but so are most of the 62% that the richest 400 people own more wealth than..... imagine that... 400 people own more wealth than 62% of all American...... do suppose it is due to their working more? More likely the richest were just so rich that they could change tax laws and rig wall street more, hence from the 80s on the rich became even more rich and everyone else, ALL working people have become poorer. a solution: Air traffic controllers and pre-school teachers are being furloughed or laid off. Mental health programs, scientific research, and unemployment benefits are being slashed -- all thanks to the sequester. Meanwhile, Wall Street speculators just had their best week ever. Working families should't be forced to shoulder the burden of economic recovery. Wall Street's reckless behavior got us in this mess -- it's time they paid to clean it up and started creating real jobs for American workers. It's time Wall Street paid to clean up the mess it created and put Americans back to work -- and we can make it happen. Tell Congress: Tax Wall Street speculation and put Americans back to work

The 80's coincided with the deindustrialization of America and the creation of the formalized welfare state. In the early 90's the massive military builddown left us with little heavy manufacturing capability, and as of this year the United States no longer manufactures or for the most part fields Main Battle Tanks (Obama thinks they are tools of oppression). So what happened to the M1A2SEP? We largely left them in Kuwait, and those few we didn't are almost entirely in one formation. So what would happen should North Korea invade the south this fall? I could have told you from 1980 to 2004 or so, but I have no idea since then, it could go either way. Depends on how the ROK troops hold up, which historical precedent would seem to indicate we'd get our rears kicked. The only reason the North has for staying its hand is that the longer the Obama administration continues the weaker we get, and that the only triggers for going forward are our destruction of their nuclear capability (or attempted destruction) an incipient famine that only a surge South will prevent (to both reduce population and capture foodstuffs), or a power struggle near the top that needs an external enemy to take advantage of.

Message.Title: Mike Huckabee Threatens GOP:
Message.Msg: Support Marriage Equality And Evangelicals Will Form Third Party By David Badash Mike Huckabee is threatening the GOP, warning them that if they support same-sex marriage, evangelicals will form a third party. Former Family Research Council president Gary Bauer and current FRC president Tony Perkins have recently both echoed those words. When asked by the website Newsmax “if he sees the GOP ever pivoting and backing gay marriage,” Huckabee admitted they might.

For you, I recommend hiding under your bed for a few years , since your worries about Korea seem to have unhinged what little brain power you had left from worrying about hordes of Iraqis invading the usa and before that the hordes of viets.

Well more freaking excellent, that will let us get the religious wacko's OUT of the Republican party and take it back toward a more Libertarian bent with liberty AND equality for ALL. Instead of for everyone except those whose moral views we as individuals don't agree with. Sure it'll repel a core constituency of the right, but they''re only a recent Constituency before being diehard Democrats until Democrats decided that pandering to racial differences would gain them a larger one. At the time it seemed logical as most Blacks were also reverent Christians at the time, and the Christian Conservatives in the South had been Democrats for decades. By combining the two they thought to create a more powerful voting bloc by taking the entire African American vote from the Republican party. And it worked, to a point, at least in advancing the Civil Rights Movement and bringing in a larger constituency, but the tactics they used to achieve it grated on Southern Dixiecrats so much that the South largely became a Republican voting block out of pure backlash. So, push the Evangelicals back toward the left and the Republican party will consist almost entirely of rational people, meaning they'll lose every election 80:20 or worse (in the cities). The two remaining parties will be the Democrats and the Christians. Oh joy. I really don't like that conclusion, is there any way someone can rework the data there?

No large corporation at least in the information sciences field pays minimum wage to anyone but interns. Since most US large corporations are largely Intellectual Property based now rather than expressed through manufacturing power, that would be most of them. Those cleaners you see in there making minimum wage certainly aren't hired by the companies directly, but rather work for service agencies hired by companies to do their cleaning, and are prohibited from certain areas. Even the scrummy startup I was involved in paid more than that to our technical service people (yes, we did our own, such as it was, rather than out contracting). That is, if we paid anything at all . . . in some cases we had player volunteers helping in organizing, managing, and proctoring our forums, etc, for the benefit of the other players. The game doesn't allow modding so that was as close as they could come to "creating user content". Now we have a program were if they want a particular feature added to the game, well, they can help pay the development costs . . . . and some do! It's incredible out there.

the fact is, wages for all americans have not made gains. The richest few, however have seen their wealth increase many many times inflation....the top 1% now take in about 20% of all USA income, nearly double what it was 30 years ago or so. As for the minimum wage, it has fallen further behind and is less now than it was in 1968 in real terms....middleclass workers have done somewhat better, but still only the top few % have made gains and they have made such huge gains that on graph it looks like mt Everest and the entire middleclass is barely distinguishable from the bottom 50%. and futher, your contempt for huge segments of the economy is a disgrace. you seem to imply that retail and food service or janitorial and so on are not important and hence deserve low wages. right now an income of just $35k crosses over into the top half of incomes....jeez.... righties whine about having to add a 5% surcharge to pay for the healthcare of Denny's workers, (a dennys owner did that)... he was in a tizzy about 50 cents on a $10 order of pancakes, so no health insurance for the help? ....but oddly enough denny's sells pancakes in Canada and all the workers there get healthcare....oh... and in EVERY OTHER modern capitalist nation it the world...... but here, you see.... we worry about the billionaires.....

Message.Title: Customers Flee Wal-Mart Empty Shelves for Target, Costco
Message.Msg: It’s not as though the merchandise isn’t there. It’s piling up in aisles and in the back of stores because Wal-Mart doesn’t have enough bodies to restock the shelves, according to interviews with store workers. In the past five years, the world’s largest retailer added 455 U.S. Wal-Mart stores, a 13 percent increase, according to filings and the company’s website. In the same period, its total U.S. workforce, which includes Sam’s Club employees, dropped by about 20,000, or 1.4 percent. Wal-Mart employs about 1.4 million U.S. workers. Customers Flee Wal-Mart Empty Shelves for Target, Costco
and if the short interest drops on 3/30 - what say you?

Message.Title: Whoops! another obamacare lie
Message.Msg: **“But we feel pretty strongly that with subsidies available to a lot of that population** First folks have to pay higher health premium cost, and then have to pay again to subsides low income and illegals free healthcare... you koolaid drinking dopes on the left will feel the pain as well...what a bunch of fools. Sebelius: Yep, ObamaCare is raising insurance costs A watershed moment in the ongoing disaster of ObamaCare, as Health and Human Services Secretary Kathleen Sebelius finally admits that health insurance premiums are rising because of the President’s health insurance takeover, per the Wall Street Journal: Ms. Sebelius’s remarks come weeks before insurers are expected to begin releasing rates for plans that start on Jan. 1, 2014, when key provisions of the health law kick in. Premiums have been a sensitive subject for the Obama administration, which is counting on elements in the health law designed to increase competition among insurers to keep rates in check. The administration has pointed to subsidies that will be available for many lower-income Americans to help them with the cost of coverage. The secretary’s remarks are among the first direct statements from federal officials that people who have skimpy health plans right now could face higher premiums for plans that are more generous. She noted that the law requires plans to provide better benefits and treat all customers equally regardless of their medical claims. “These folks will be moving into a really fully insured product for the first time, and so there may be a higher cost associated with getting into that market,” she said. “But we feel pretty strongly that with subsidies available to a lot of that population that they are really going to see much better benefit for the money that they’re spending.”

Message.Title: Get the hogs out of the trough. (2010 USA spent 18% of gdp for health care, the avg for OECD nations is half that)
Message.Msg: (2010 USA spent 18% of gdp for health care, the avg for OECD nations is half that) We don’t get more health care; we just pay more — much more. And this entirely accounts for the scary long-term deficit projections. If we paid what every other advanced industrial country pays, we would project surpluses as far as the eye can see and be able to begin investing in areas vital to our future — like educating our kids. It’s not “entitlements,” “greedy geezers,” the “takers,” public worker salaries and pensions, teachers’ unions, big government, out of control spending, or even cost of policing the world. A corrupted congress allows entrenched corporate lobbies to protect their right to rip us off. It isn’t more complicated than that. Every other explanation is hogwash. Take a look at the graphs. Remember them the next time Speaker Boehner babbles about out of control spending. Or the White House floats cutting Social Security with a chained CPI. Or the various Pete Peterson fronts rail about deficits. Want to rebuild America? Want to provide pre-school for all or affordable college? Want to get our books in order? Get the damn hogs out of the trough. Health Care Costs: The Rip Off That Bankrupts America by Robert Borosage

Topic.Title: Get the hogs out of the trough. (2010 USA spent 18% of gdp for health care, the avg for OECD nations is half that)

Message.Msg: We actually pay about the same for the actual health care, maybe alittle less given our uninsured rate . . . here's the rub though, we count the cost of the administration of the health care paperwork, as well as overhead, and other items. In some of the other countries, health care administrative expenses are born by the general fisc. In other words, its just a different color of money (as they used to tell me at MIT). I pointed out that maintaining an archaic system whose service contract was so expensive you could buy a "new" used machine every month was stupid. They told me "new machines" were capital expenditures, but "service contracts" were a different color of money so no, I couldn't go just buy a pile of spare parts and maintain it internally and save a fortune. I replaced the pathetic thing with a Mac. With a service contract. Who knows, it may still be there in one form or another.

Didn't you read my post? Why do you repeat what I just said? 9/11 was inside job and Democrats(including those in 9/11 commission) chose to ignore full investigation to put George W Bush in prison. So now we have to live with conspiracy theories. "April 29, 2007 A 750-foot section of Interstate 580 in Oakland collapsed early Sunday after a gasoline tanker truck overturned and caught fire". The overpass was built with same materials as WTC. Not trying to convince you. For some people common sense just doesn't exist.

I think we will have a good qtr and your news should hopefully reduce failures and more write-offs. I also read about DTA's( deferred tax credits) while big banks have loads, so do we. If we start using those it will be great news.

Message.Title: As of 2009, health spending in the U.S. was about 90% higher than in many other industrialized countries
Message.Msg: How Does U.S. Health Spending Compare with Other Countries? .............. The U.S. spends substantially more on health care than other developed countries. As of 2009, health spending in the U.S. was about 90% higher than in many other industrialized countries. Health Care Costs: A Primer The Kaiser foundation, 2012
